intro: Derris palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. Derris palawanensis is often found in forest understories and is adapted to humid, tropical conditions.
